content:
• Thursday, January 17, 2013
  • TEVA

    The FDA approves NuPathe's (PATH) Zecuity for the acute treatment of migraine with or without...

    The FDA approves NuPathe's (PATH) Zecuity for the acute treatment of migraine with or without aura in adults. The drug is a single-use, battery-powered patch that actively delivers sumatriptan, the most widely prescribed migraine medication, through the skin. Shares surge +18% after resuming trade following an earlier halt.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • AM-OLD

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AM-OLD +9%. ARAY +4%. SOXS +3%. EGLE +3%. ONXX +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AM-OLD +9%. ARAY +4%. SOXS +3%. EGLE +3%. ONXX +2%.
    After-hours top losers: COF -8%. TSRX -6%. PATH -5%. INTC -4%. MAKO -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • AMD

    AMD -2.6% AH in response to Intel's Q4 report, which featured a slight revenue miss and somewhat...

    AMD -2.6% AH in response to Intel's Q4 report, which featured a slight revenue miss and somewhat light Q1 guidance, as well as (in the CFO comments) remarks about "aggressive tactical actions" to cut inventory. Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is unchanged for now.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger Ltd. (NYSE:SLB) declares $0.3125/share quarterly dividend, 13.6% increase from...

    Schlumberger Ltd. (NYSE:SLB) declares $0.3125/share quarterly dividend, 13.6% increase from prior dividend of $0.275. Forward yield 1.70%. For shareholders of record Feb. 20. Payable Apr. 12. Ex-div date Feb. 18. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • MRK

    Trius Therapeutics (TSRX) announces a secondary offering, no details as to the actual size or...

    Trius Therapeutics (TSRX) announces a secondary offering, no details as to the actual size or terms of the offering have been disclosed. Citigroup and Leerink Swann are acting as joint book-running managers and Baird is acting as a co-lead manager. Shares -5.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • TESS

    TESSCO Technologies (NASDAQ:TESS): FQ3 EPS of $0.65. Revenue of $204.5M (-10% Y/Y). Shares -3.6%...

    TESSCO Technologies (NASDAQ:TESS): FQ3 EPS of $0.65. Revenue of $204.5M (-10% Y/Y). Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • UNXL

    Uni-Pixel (UNXL -8.9%) closed with big losses following a critical column yesterday evening from...

    Uni-Pixel (UNXL -8.9%) closed with big losses following a critical column yesterday evening from SA's Benjamin Wiley. Wiley argues the addressable market for UniPixel's metal grids (used in touchscreen sensors) is smaller than many think, and that the company would lose money in 2013 even if grabbed 5% of the table/e-reader market and sold its products at a 50% margin. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 12 Comments
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $509.8M (flat% Y/Y) misses by...

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $509.8M (flat% Y/Y) misses by $17.86M. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • BKMU

    Bank Mutual (NASDAQ:BKMU): Q4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.01. Shares +26.5% AH. (PR)

    Bank Mutual (NASDAQ:BKMU): Q4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.01. Shares +26.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • COF

    Capital One (NYSE:COF): Q4 EPS of $1.41 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $5.6B (-3% Y/Y) misses by...

    Capital One (NYSE:COF): Q4 EPS of $1.41 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $5.6B (-3% Y/Y) misses by $0.28B. Shares -3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • MDT

    Medtronic (MDT +3%) posts a healthy gain today after Credit Suisse ups the shares to Outperform...

    Medtronic (MDT +3%) posts a healthy gain today after Credit Suisse ups the shares to Outperform and raised its price target from $47 to $50. The firm cites "sustainable improvement" in top-line growth and a healthy revamp of its strategic directives.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE +6.4%) is closing with big gains thanks to a rally in Japanese equities and positive...

    Sony (SNE +6.4%) is closing with big gains thanks to a rally in Japanese equities and positive comments from CEO Kazuo Hirai. Hirai, who has announced huge job cuts and a giant debt offering since taking over as CEO last year, promises Sony's phone business - now focused on high-end Android gear - will be a profit driver. The company forecasts its smartphone sales will rise 50% in FY13 (ends March 31) to 51M, but it faces stiff competition from Samsung and a slew of Chinese vendors who are moving upmarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCI

    Tyco (TYC +2.8%) trades at session highs on the back of the Boeing (NYSE:BA) battery issue....

    Tyco (TYC +2.8%) trades at session highs on the back of the Boeing (NYSE:BA) battery issue. Earlier headlines from an FAA investigation have batteries in the 787 Dreamliner possibly being from a faulty batch, which may be at the center of the problem. Tyco Electronics supplies interconnection products and other electronic components to BA for a number of different aircraft programs, including the Dreamliner.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 5 Comments
  • CXO

    Concho Resources (CXO +1.6%) is initiated at Outperform by Imperial Capital, which says the...

    Concho Resources (CXO +1.6%) is initiated at Outperform by Imperial Capital, which says the pure-play, oil-focused Permian Basin company benefits from strong production growth, long-lived reserves, a low-cost structure and low-risk production and growth opportunities. The firm likes CXO's commitment to rate-of-return driven growth, reinvesting cash flow into its highest margin plays.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • BIG

    Shares of Big Lots (BIG +5.4%) shoot higher after dealReporter points to increasing talk between...

    Shares of Big Lots (BIG +5.4%) shoot higher after dealReporter points to increasing talk between the company and LBO specialists.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • KMI

    RBC Capital reiterates its Outperform rating for Kinder Morgan (KMI +1.5%), raising its price...

    RBC Capital reiterates its Outperform rating for Kinder Morgan (KMI +1.5%), raising its price target to $44 and issuing bullish comments on the El Paso (NYSE:EPB) acquisition, which the firm says provides highly-visible cash flow growth. KMI's Q4 earnings more than doubled as it reported strong demand for the transport of natural gas from affiliates Kinder Morgan Partners (NYSE:KMP) and El Paso.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • EBAY

    eBay (EBAY +2.9%) is making new highs yet again, as investors brush off the ho-hum guidance...

    eBay (EBAY +2.9%) is making new highs yet again, as investors brush off the ho-hum guidance (viewed by some as conservative) found in its Q4 report and instead focus on very strong PayPal and mobile growth. Nomura is worried a bit about PayPal's margin decline (the result of aggressive spending under new chief David Marcus), but reiterates a Buy. Others are encouraged by Marketplaces' strength, the product of mobile activity and a revamped site. OSTK +4.7%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +1.1%) ticks up after preliminary results might indicate the problem with the 787...

    Boeing (BA +1.1%) ticks up after preliminary results might indicate the problem with the 787 Dreamliner may lie in a battery issue with the manufacturer. GS Yuasa, the Japanese battery supplier to BA's grounded fleet says it may take months to determine whether the cause was in fact the battery or the entire electrical system.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 4 Comments
  • NEWL

    NewLead Holdings (NEWL +43.7%) shares soar on news the shipper of energy products signed deals...

    NewLead Holdings (NEWL +43.7%) shares soar on news the shipper of energy products signed deals to acquire title and excavation rights in properties containing 18.6M tons of estimated coal reserves for $11M and acquire ownership and leasehold interests in properties containing ~143M tons of coal for $55M. NEWL expects the three-year supply contracts to generate $873M of revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • CSIQ

    Nomura is making a bullish call on Chinese solar stocks, upgrading Canadian Solar (CSIQ +7.5%),...

    Nomura is making a bullish call on Chinese solar stocks, upgrading Canadian Solar (CSIQ +7.5%), Trina (TSL +0.9%), and JA Solar (JASO +6.4%) to Buy. All three companies have already posted huge gains since mid-December, aided by short-covering and the Chinese government's efforts to prop up local manufacturers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 3 Comments
  • ADTN

    A day after rallying thanks to favorable Q1/2013 guidance to go with its Q4 report, Adtran (ADTN...

    A day after rallying thanks to favorable Q1/2013 guidance to go with its Q4 report, Adtran (ADTN -4%) is lower following a downgrade to Sell from UBS. The firm has made some accurate calls about telecom equipment names in the past.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • ALKS

    Shares of Alkermes (ALKS -0.4%) fail to get a spark from todays buying, largely due to Credit...

    Shares of Alkermes (ALKS -0.4%) fail to get a spark from todays buying, largely due to Credit Suisse initiating the stock with a tepid Neutral rating and lackluster $24 price target. The firm says ALKS has an enticing long-term story, but its recent run (the stock is already +21% YTD versus +7% for its peers) leaves the broker looking for a better entry point. Additionally, a potentially negative readout for its depression drug candidate ALKS 5461 poses near-term risks.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • TSM

    TSMC (TSM +2.5%) has hit levels last seen during the Dot.com bubble after delivering an in-line...

    TSMC (TSM +2.5%) has hit levels last seen during the Dot.com bubble after delivering an in-line Q4 report (revenue was already known thanks to monthly reports) and guiding for a smaller Q/Q sales drop for seasonally weak Q1 than was expected. The world's top chip foundry claims 22% of Q4 wafer sales involved its cutting-edge 28nm process - TSMC struggled with 28nm yield issues earlier in 2012. Chip stocks are getting a lift from the report (SOXX +1.4%), and from ASML's guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • ALNY

    Alnyam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY -1.3%) slips on further dilution as the underwriters of its recent...

    Alnyam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY -1.3%) slips on further dilution as the underwriters of its recent secondary offering exercise options to purchase an additional 1.2M shares at $20.13. The purchase increases the size of the offering from 8M to 9.2M and boosts the net proceeds to ALNY to $173.8M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • SSKN

    Mela Sciences (MELA -7.6%) trades lower today after the company gave its presentation at...

    Mela Sciences (MELA -7.6%) trades lower today after the company gave its presentation at Needham's Growh Conference yesterday, saying it plans to restructure its manufacturing operations this year to "significantly reduce manufacturing costs" of MelaFind, its hand-held device identifying possible melanoma, in an effort to relieve pressure on its margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • NEWL

    Midday top 10 gainers: NEWL +55%. KSWS +48%. SSE-OLD +44%. HMNY +21%. OTC:CALI +25%. GV +18%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: NEWL +55%. KSWS +48%. SSE-OLD +44%. HMNY +21%. OTC:CALI +25%. GV +18%. FSI +14%. SHIP +14%. HILL +13%. NLS +13%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: HOTR -17%. AMS -13%. PWER -8%. MY -8%. FET -7%. SZYM -8%. CLSN -8%. LEAP -7%. FOLD -7%. MELA -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • DDC

    Harry Winston Diamond’s (HWD -2.3%) $500M acquisition of a majority stake in the Ekati...

    Harry Winston Diamond’s (HWD -2.3%) $500M acquisition of a majority stake in the Ekati mine is challenged by minority owner Chuck Fipke, who discovered the property in the Northwest Territories; he claims his pre-emptive rights to buy the stake from BHP Billiton are not being upheld, and that HWD is “complicit" in the alleged non-compliance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge (SD +3.1%) receives more flak from top shareholders, as 4.5%-owner Mount Kellett...

    SandRidge (SD +3.1%) receives more flak from top shareholders, as 4.5%-owner Mount Kellett Capital calls on SD's board to investigate allegations that CEO Tom Ward and a company run by his son engaged in "persistent front-running of the company... [leveraging their] knowledge of the Mississippian play, at the expense of shareholders, to acquire properties."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • P

    Pandora (P -1.1%) has ticked lower on an NY Post report Sony/ATV (NYSE:SNE) has negotiated a 25%...

    Pandora (P -1.1%) has ticked lower on an NY Post report Sony/ATV (NYSE:SNE) has negotiated a 25% increase in royalties. The reported hike comes as Pandora lobbies hard to bring its royalty rates in line with those of satellite radio providers via the Internet Radio Fairness Act. The paper adds Sony/ATV "will now seek better deals from other digital music players," and that other music publishers could try to negotiate new deals. Update: Rocco Pendola notes the Sony/ATV deal involves composition/publishing rights, which make up only 4% of Pandora's content costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • ASML

    Down initially following its Q4 report, ASML (ASML +8%) is now rallying strongly. Though revenue...

    Down initially following its Q4 report, ASML (ASML +8%) is now rallying strongly. Though revenue was below estimates, EPS was above, and the lithography giant guided for 2013 sales to be "at a similar level to that of 2012" thanks to a 2H demand pickup. That's going over well in light of bleak industry forecasts. ASML sees investments in advanced 14-20nm processes driving demand, though it expects the memory industry to "continue investing at a minimum level" (a positive for SNDK and MU). CYMI +6.2%. KLAC +6.5%. LRCX +3.3%. AMAT +1.8%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • CLSN

    Celsion (CLSN -6.4%) slides after Brean Capital cut the shares to Sell earlier today. Brean says...

    Celsion (CLSN -6.4%) slides after Brean Capital cut the shares to Sell earlier today. Brean says in a note to clients that the stock has ramped up significantly due to heightened expectations over clinical trials for it's RFAT liver cancer treatment, which is expected this month. The firm calls it "a highly binary event in 1Q13 that, in our view, will define whether or not the company remains viable thereafter." This caution is shared by a Seeing Alpha contributor: Recalculating Celsion's Upcoming Results.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP -6.2%) slumps on a downgrade to Underperform from Jefferies, which notes...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP -6.2%) slumps on a downgrade to Underperform from Jefferies, which notes business trends are weak and say it doesn't view the carrier's spectrum (which has made it the subject of non-stop M&A speculation) a "must-have" asset. Moreover, even if there is interest in Leap's spectrum, Jefferies doesn't activity picking up until 2H (i.e. a point where T-Mobile/MetroPCS and Sprint/SoftBank/Clearwire will have likely closed).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • ISRG

    Shares of Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -2.2%) dip on a Citron Research report claiming the company...

    Shares of Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -2.2%) dip on a Citron Research report claiming the company has made "outrageous marketing claims" that leave it exposed to legal backlash. It goes on to accuse the robotic surgical device maker of failing to adequately disclose the number fatalities and injuries due to da Vinci procedures, and the actual reasons for "such adverse outcomes."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 4 Comments
  • CIEN

    Ciena (CIEN +3.7%) rallies after announcing Comcast will deploy the company's 6500...

    Ciena (CIEN +3.7%) rallies after announcing Comcast will deploy the company's 6500 Packet-Optical platform, which puts Ethernet switching and optical transmission capabilities in the same box. Moreover, the 6500 will be used to support 100G optical links with the help of Ciena's WaveLogic processors - investors are counting on 100G deployments to fuel 2013 growth. Ciena moved higher yesterday in response to Adtran's Q1/2013 guidance. Rival Infinera was upgraded this morning by JPMorgan.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • CAS

    A. M. Castle (CAS +3.9%) moves higher today after announcing restructuring plans that include an...

    A. M. Castle (CAS +3.9%) moves higher today after announcing restructuring plans that include an organizational revamp, workforce cuts of around 10%, warehouse realignments and performance improvement programs. CAS believes the measures should improve annualized operating profit by $33M once fully implemented, and expects to take a pre-tax charge of around $10M in FY13.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • LQDT

    Liquidity Services (LQDT -2.2%) slips after saying late yesterday that its FQ1 gross merchandise...

    Liquidity Services (LQDT -2.2%) slips after saying late yesterday that its FQ1 gross merchandise volume missed expectations due to several delayed energy equipment sales in its capital assets group. Merchandise volume was approximately $234M, falling below company estimates of between $240M and $250M. The company did however reaffirm its adjusted FQ1 earnings outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • TSL

    Trina (TSL +2.6%) trades higher after announcing it has supplied 61MW of modules for a German...

    Trina (TSL +2.6%) trades higher after announcing it has supplied 61MW of modules for a German solar project. Given the current state of European solar demand, Trina can use all the good news its can get on this front.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • NUS

    Nu Skin (NYSE:NUS) jumps 8.3% after saying late yesterday that it expects Q4 EPS of $0.94-0.96,...

    Nu Skin (NYSE:NUS) jumps 8.3% after saying late yesterday that it expects Q4 EPS of $0.94-0.96, above consensus of $0.83, and revenues of +19% to $588M vs prior forecast of $530M and Street estimates of $531.57M. After record revenue of $2.17B in 2012, Nu Skin expects "that 2013 will be yet another record year." CFO due to present at at ICR XChange Conference at 12 pm ET. (Presentation)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced (GTAT +7%) pops after Jefferies declares the bad news priced in and upgrades shares...

    GT Advanced (GTAT +7%) pops after Jefferies declares the bad news priced in and upgrades shares to Hold. While cutting estimates on GT and arguing there's additional backlog risk, the firm also notes shares trade roughly at book value, and it sees orders for sapphire LED and solar polysilicon manufacturing equipment potentially acting as 2H and 2014 catalysts (though it wants to see more visibility). 30.3% of the float was shorted as of Dec. 31. (restructuring plans)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • PWER

    Power-One (PWER -11.3%) tumbles after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $190M-$195M and a net...

    Power-One (PWER -11.3%) tumbles after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $190M-$195M and a net loss of $12M-$15M, well below a consensus of $221.4M in revenue of $0.07 in EPS. The maker of power supplies and solar inverters blames weak solar demand, primarily in Italy and Germany. Shares are now within striking distance of their 52-week low. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • JNPR

    In addition to downgrading Cisco, JPMorgan is upgrading (I, II) Juniper (JNPR +3.3%) and...

    In addition to downgrading Cisco, JPMorgan is upgrading (I, II) Juniper (JNPR +3.3%) and Infinera (INFN +6.6%) to Overweight. The firm sees improving 2013 carrier capex, new routers, stock buybacks, and "a proactive focus on operating leverage" aiding Juniper, which is about to partly upend its business model in an effort to embrace software-defined networking. Infinera is expected to benefit from rising demand for 100G optical gear and its high-end DTN-X system, which now has 5 tier-1 carrier clients. Separately, Infinera discloses sales chief Ronald Martin is leaving, while assuring investors there's no change to 2012 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • FAST

    More on Fastenal (FAST +2.7%) Q4: net profit +12.9% to $98.7M, boosted by addition of 80 new...

    More on Fastenal (FAST +2.7%) Q4: net profit +12.9% to $98.7M, boosted by addition of 80 new stores in 2012 and the addition of 13,642 industrial vending machines. Expects to open another 65-80 stores in 2013. Although sales rose, momentum slowed as demand weakened in the American manufacturing sector, while Superstorm Sandy also hurt earnings. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • LEN

    A check on the homebuilder ETFs finds both XHB and ITB about 1% higher premarket following the...

    A check on the homebuilder ETFs finds both XHB and ITB about 1% higher premarket following the big housing starts number. It's no news multi-family starts were of particular strength (longer-term chart), and Lennar (NYSE:LEN) got on board this week, announcing its entry into that segment of the business.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • TELL

    Magellan Petroleum (MPET) -7.5% premarket on news it is repurchasing ~9.26M shares of its common...

    Magellan Petroleum (MPET) -7.5% premarket on news it is repurchasing ~9.26M shares of its common stock, or 17% of total shares outstanding, from Glencore subsidiary Sopak.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • CCL

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL) renews its $1B share repurchase authorization, saying it still has $165M...

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL) renews its $1B share repurchase authorization, saying it still has $165M remaining on the plan after factoring in recent buys. CCL +1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • CREE

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) -1.9% following a downgrade to Underperform from Jefferies, the latest move...

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) -1.9% following a downgrade to Underperform from Jefferies, the latest move in an analyst tug-of-war that has broken out over the company ahead of Tuesday's FQ2 report. While calling Cree "well positioned to benefit from one of the strongest secular growth stories in Clean Tech" (presumably LED lighting), the firm considers FY13 revenue growth expectations to be "overly optimistic," sees limited catalysts, and is worried about weak near-term market conditions.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM

  • Market Preview: U.S. stock futures get a boost from strong jobless and housing data, with the...

    Market Preview: U.S. stock futures get a boost from strong jobless and housing data, with the S&P benchmark +0.4%. Boeing is -1.7% as its Dreamliner woes pile up, although Rio Tinto is just -0.25% despite taking a $14B charge and losing a CEO. CBS is +9% after news it plans to convert its outdoor advertising business into a REIT. Following earnings, eBay is +2.4% but Citigroup is -2.5%. Later: Philly Fed Business Outlook, Fed's Lockhart
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • NEWL

    Premarket gainers: NEWL +64%. KSWS +48%. PATH +11%. CBS +9%. OTC:ROYL +8%. NUS +6%.Losers: CLSN...

    Premarket gainers: NEWL +64%. KSWS +48%. PATH +11%. CBS +9%. OTC:ROYL +8%. NUS +6%.
    Losers: CLSN -10%. AVEO -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • WSM

    Raymond James downgrades Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM) to Market Perform, down from its previous...

    Raymond James downgrades Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM) to Market Perform, down from its previous ratings perch of Strong Buy. It's a double-whammy for the retailer with Goldman Sachs also in the books with a cut to Neutral from Buy. Yesterday, the company disappointed the Street by only reiterating its guidance instead of lifting it to where analysts had set their targets. WSM -3.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) -4.7% to $13.65 after receiving a downgrade from Hold to Sell from Brean...

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) -4.7% to $13.65 after receiving a downgrade from Hold to Sell from Brean Capital, which suggests a downside of over 50% on yesterday's close of $14.32 by setting a price target of $7. Brean Capital points out that just one in five patients are covered by insurance for Vivus' Qsymia weight-loss pill, which could lead to "sticker shock" and abandonment.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 4 Comments
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tankers (NYSE:NAT) -4.3% premarket after cutting its quarterly dividend to $0.16...

    Nordic American Tankers (NYSE:NAT) -4.3% premarket after cutting its quarterly dividend to $0.16 from $0.30. NAT says it is is assessing fleet expansion plans including ordering of new vessels from shipyards or buying second-hand vessels at historically low prices, and the lower dividend should be seen in the context of the expansion.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • FET

    Forum Energy Technologies (NYSE:FET) -2.2% premarket after cutting its full-year earnings...

    Forum Energy Technologies (NYSE:FET) -2.2% premarket after cutting its full-year earnings projection, seeing EPS of $1.72-1.74 vs. $1.85 consensus and below prior guidance of $1.83-$1.88. FET blames lower than anticipated customer spending on capital equipment and consumable products especially in its drilling product line, among other factors.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:26 AM
  • RIO

    New Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) CEO Sam Walsh is given a cautious welcome by the market, as shares...

    New Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) CEO Sam Walsh is given a cautious welcome by the market, as shares move off early lows in London trading, now -1.3% - substantially less wiped off the market cap than the $14B writedown that played a part in Tom Albanese's ouster. Some see the weakness as a buying opportunity; Citi upgrades RIO to Buy from Neutral, believing the shakeup "could significantly realign Rio Tinto with shareholder interests through reduced M&A and reduced capital expenditure spend."
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 AM | 2 Comments
  • BAC

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC): Q4 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $18.89B misses by $3.51B....

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC): Q4 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $18.89B misses by $3.51B. Shares +2.1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:01 AM | 9 Comments
  • ASML

    ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML): Q4 EPS of €0.73 may not be comparable to consensus of...

    ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML): Q4 EPS of €0.73 may not be comparable to consensus of €0.43. Revenue of €1.02B (-15.5% Y/Y) misses by €60M. Shares -3.1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 AM

  • Asian and European markets are mixed as investors stay cautious ahead of a big day of data in...

    Asian and European markets are mixed as investors stay cautious ahead of a big day of data in China tomorrow, including Q4 GDP. Australia hits a 20 month after an unexpected drop in employment prompted expectations for another cut in interest rates. Japan +0.1%, Hong Kong -0.1%, China -1.1%, India +0.6%, Australia +0.4% to 4,756.6. EU Stoxx 50 +0.15%, London flat, Paris +0.5%, Frankfurt -0.2%, Milan +0.7%, Madrid +0.6%.

  • ASML

    ASML Holding (ASML -3.2% in Amsterdam): Q4 net profit +4.6% to €298M, boosted by...

    ASML Holding (ASML -3.2% in Amsterdam): Q4 net profit +4.6% to €298M, boosted by €115.8M tax benefit. Sales -15.7% to €1.02B. Net booking, excluding next-gen EUV machine, €667M vs €831M in Q3. To ship first NXE:3300B EUV tool in Q2, with the aim being to move 11 in 2013 for sales value of €700M. Expects 2013 revs similar to 2012; forecasts Q1 sales of €850M. Declares 2012 dividend of €0.53/share vs €0.46 in 2011. (PR)

  • RIO

    More on Rio Tinto (RIO -3.1% in London) CEO quitting: Doug Ritchie, who led the acquisition and...

    More on Rio Tinto (RIO -3.1% in London) CEO quitting: Doug Ritchie, who led the acquisition and integration of the Mozambique coal assets, is also leaving. He and Albanese will receive no payoff. Mozambique assets written down by $3B, due to intractable infrastructure problems and a cut in estimates of recoverable coking coal volumes. Aluminum assets written down by $10-11B, with Rio citing deterioration in aluminum market, forex fluctuations, and high energy and raw material costs. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 AM
